page.title: 15The Old Railway-27 Years On
page.content: The Old L.N.W.R. line in Abergavenny closed in 1958.The route crossed the Brecon Rd.on a two arched bridge near the Station Hotel.It then crossed the River Usk by a 7 span iron bridge.The foundations can still be seen.Much of the route can still be traced.The embankment on either side of the Brecon Rd. can be seen very overgrown.A new road is being built on the route.The land was cleared and filled with stones and soil.New factories will be built beside the road.The station site is now used by the Electricity Board.Part of the railway lodging house is now a social club and the rest is the house of Lucy Tatum who attends Harold Rd. School.The goods shed is now a D.I.Y. warehouse and the engine shed is a council depot.
